attributes.action: Give a universal decision on the completion of university amid COVID-19.
attributes.additional_details: Some universities have given 4-week extensions and implemented safety nets or no detriment policies, while others are giving no extensions. A lot of students are worried about COVID-19 and a decision from the government would reduce worry and confusion about completing university. Schools and colleges have answers, whereas university students are confused and stressed, about failing or losing marks, due to unfair circumstances beyond their control, as a result of this pandemic.
attributes.background: Announce a universal decision as to how universities across the country should be helping students and changing deadlines, during the COVID-19 pandemic.

rejection.details:
Decisions about university assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

If you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
